conclusion: To find the time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary AB in the transparent body ABDE with a right-angled trapezoid cross-section.
The light travels from point O to point B along the path OB. The angle of incidence at point O is 45 degrees.
The refractive index n of the transparent body is sqrt(2).
Using Snell's Law to calculate the refracted angle: sin(theta2) = 1/2, therefore theta2 = 30 degrees.
Determine the distance OB using trigonometry and the sine rule: OB = sqrt(2).
The speed of light in the medium is v = c/sqrt(2), where c is the speed of light in a vacuum.
The time t for light to travel from point O to the boundary AB is 2/c.
